pageTitle: Buses replace trains as improvement works take place at White City

title.title: Buses replace trains as improvement works take place at White City

texts: Buses will replace trains between North Acton and Marble Arch as improvement works are taking place at White City on 11 September; 29 and 30 October; 5, 6, 20 and 27 November and 2 January 2006.
The work is being undertaken in support of the White City Development.
Special shuttle train services will operate:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["between West Ruislip and North Acton","between Ealing Broadway and North Acton"]}
Two Rail Replacement Bus Services will operate:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Service A: between North Acton and Willesden Junction","Service B: between North Acton and Shepherd's Bush."]}
Passengers travelling from/to the following stations are advised to use the following routes:
West Ruislip

*Chiltern line services from/to Marylebone;
Metropolitan line from/to Ickenham;
Ruislip Gardens
Metropolitan line from/to Ruislip or Ruislip Manor;
South Ruislip
*Chiltern line from/to Marylebone;
Greenford
First Great Western Link services from/to Paddington (no Sunday service);
Hangar Lane
Piccadilly line services from/to Park Royal (Except 11 September);
Ealing Broadway

District line (except 11 September; 20 and 27 November);
First Great Western Link services from/to Paddington;
West Acton
Piccadilly Line services from/to North Ealing;
Shepherd's Bush

Hammersmith & City line (additional service will
operate);
Queensway
District and Circle lines from/to Bayswater (except 11 September; 20 and 27 November);
*Chiltern Railways will carry out engineering works on some weekends. For more information please visit: http://www.chilternrailways.co.uk/
Customers should allow an extra 30 minutes to complete their journeys especially those wishing to make the last train connections.

For 24-hour information on public transport in London, please call: 020 7222 1234.

TfL's Realtime pages display live travel information on London's public transport network: www.tfl.gov.uk/realtime
Journey Planner checks the transport network's status before providing results. The best available route is shown automatically: www.tfl.gov.uk/journeyplanner
Travel alerts via SMS and email can be set up at: www.tfl.gov.uk/alerts
